tool_input.prompt: Extract the complete details about the 1966 Hugo Award winners, focusing on the tie between Dune and This Immortal, voting results if available, and any specific details about the award ceremony at Tricon in Cleveland.

tool_response.result:
Here are the key details about the 1966 Hugo Awards:

Location and Date:
- Presented at Tricon in Cleveland from September 1-5, 1966
- Toastmaster was Isaac Asimov

Best Novel Category (Unique Tie):
- Frank Herbert's "Dune" won (tied)
- Roger Zelazny's "...And Call Me Conrad" (also titled "This Immortal") also won
- Other nominees included works by John Brunner, Robert A. Heinlein, and Edward E. Smith

Notable Short Fiction Winner:
- Harlan Ellison's "'Repent, Harlequin!' Said the Ticktockman" won best short fiction

Interesting Additional Category:
- "Best All-Time Series" was won by Isaac Asimov's "Foundation" series
- Other series in this category included works by Edgar Rice Burroughs, Robert A. Heinlein, Edward E. Smith, and J.R.R. Tolkien

The document does not provide specific voting tallies or ceremony details beyond these basic facts.
